verses.roman:
'caṇḍāla--pavitra yāṅra śrī-nāma-śravaṇe
hena-tomāra ei jīva pāila daraśane

synonyms: caṇḍāla—the dog-eater, the lowest of mankind; pavitra—purified; yāṅra—of whom; śrī-nāma-śravaṇe—by hearing the holy name; hena-tomāra—of such a one as You; ei jīva—this conditioned living entity; pāila—has gotten; daraśane—the personal visit.
translation: "Simply by hearing Your holy name, a caṇḍāla, lowest of men, can be purified. Now this conditioned soul has received Your personal interview.
